PlaceholderDesc_Tale_Condition_ValueName: Name of the field which value is getting checked
PlaceholderDesc_Tale_Condition_ValueOper: Operator used for the compare. This is generated based on the different operator templates.
Start of the content that will only be rendered if the operator is a primitive operator (=, !=, <, <=, ...). Must be closed using Tale_Condition_ValueOperator_IsPrimitive_End.
End of the content that will only be rendered if the operator is a primitive operator (=, !=, <, <=, ...).
Start of the content that will only be rendered if the operator is a non-primitive operator (contains, startsWith, endsWith). Must be closed using Tale_Condition_ValueOperator_IsNonPrimitive_End.
End of the content that will only be rendered if the operator is a non-primitive operator (contains, startsWith, endsWith).
PlaceholderDesc_Tale_Condition_ValueIsNu: Start of the content that will only be rendered if the field which is getting checked is a number field. Must be closed using Tale_Condition_ValueIsNumber_End.
End of the content that will only be rendered if the field which is getting checked is a number field.
PlaceholderDesc_Tale_Condition_ValueIsSt: Start of the content that will only be rendered if the field which is getting checked is a string field. Must be closed using Tale_Condition_ValueIsString_End.
End of the content that will only be rendered if the field which is getting checked is a string field.
PlaceholderDesc_Tale_Condition_ValueName: Start of the content that will only be rendered if the name of the field that is checked equals a certain value. 'NAME_OF_FIELD' must be replaced with the name to check. The comparison is case-insensitive. Must be closed using Tale_Condition_ValueName_Equals_End.
End of the content that will only be rendered if the name equals a certain value.

Start of the content that will only be rendered if the name of the field that is checked not equals a certain value. 'NAME_OF_FIELD' must be replaced with the name to check. The comparison is case-insensitive. Must be closed using Tale_Condition_ValueName_NotEquals_End.
End of the content that will only be rendered if the name not equals a certain value.
